codearea.control

Class StyledTextArea<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • codearea.control.StyledTextArea<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - type of style that can be applied to text.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClipboardActions, EditActions, NavigationActions, TextEditingArea, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InlineStyleTextArea, StyleClassedTextArea

    public class StyledTextArea<S>
extends javafx.scene.control.Control
implements TextEditingArea, EditActions, ClipboardActions, NavigationActions
    Text input component suitable for source code editing. It allows a user to enter plain text, which can then be styled programmatically (i.e. automatically), e.g. to highlight syntax. Subclassing is allowed to define the type of style, e.g. inline style or style classes.

    • Property Detail

      • editable

        public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty editableProperty
        Indicates whether this CodeArea can be edited by the user. Note that this property doesn't affect editing through the API.
        See Also:
        isEditable(), setEditable(boolean)

      • wrapText

        public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty wrapTextProperty
        When a run of text exceeds the width of the text region, then this property indicates whether the text should wrap onto another line.
        See Also:
        isWrapText(), setWrapText(boolean)

      • font

        public final javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<javafx.scene.text.Font> fontProperty
        The default font to use for text in the TextInputControl. If the TextInputControl's text is rich text then this font may or may not be used depending on the font information embedded in the rich text, but in any case where a default font is required, this font will be used.
        Since:
        JavaFX 8.0
        See Also:
        getFont(), setFont(Font)

      • text

        public final javafx.beans.value.ObservableStringValue textProperty
        See Also:
        getText()

      • length

        public final javafx.beans.value.ObservableIntegerValue lengthProperty
        See Also:
        getLength()

      • anchor

        public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyIntegerProperty anchorProperty
        The anchor of the text selection. The anchor and caretPosition make up the selection range. Selection must always be specified in terms of begin <= end, but anchor may be less than, equal to, or greater than the caretPosition. Depending on how the user selects text, the anchor might represent the lower or upper bound of the selection.
        See Also:
        getAnchor()

      • caretPosition

        public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyIntegerProperty caretPositionProperty
        The current position of the caret within the text. The anchor and caretPosition make up the selection range. Selection must always be specified in terms of begin <= end, but anchor may be less than, equal to, or greater than the caretPosition. Depending on how the user selects text, the caretPosition might represent the lower or upper bound of the selection.
        See Also:
        getCaretPosition()

      • selection

        public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyObjectProperty<javafx.scene.control.IndexRange> selectionProperty
        The current selection.
        See Also:
        getSelection()

      • selectedText

        public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyStringProperty selectedTextProperty
        Defines the characters in the TextInputControl which are selected
        See Also:
        getSelectedText()

    • Constructor Detail

      • StyledTextArea

        public StyledTextArea(S initialStyle,
                      java.util.function.BiConsumer<javafx.scene.text.Text,S> applyStyle)
        Creates a text area with empty text content.
        Parameters:
        applyStyle - function that, given a Text node and a style, applies the style to the text node. This function is used by the default skin to apply style to text nodes.

      • getStyleAt

        public S getStyleAt(int line,
                    int column)
        Returns the style of the character in the given column at the given line. If column is beyond the end of the line, the style at the end of line is returned. If column is negative, it is the same as if it was 0.

      • createDefaultSkin

        protected javafx.scene.control.Skin<?> createDefaultSkin()

      • replaceText

        public void replaceText(int start,
                        int end,
                        java.lang.String text)
        Description copied from interface: TextEditingArea
        Replaces a range of characters with the given text. It must hold 0 <= start <= end <= getLength().
        Specified by:
        replaceText in interface TextEditingArea
        Parameters:
        start - Start index of the range to replace, inclusive.
        end - End index of the range to replace, exclusive.
        text - The text to put in place of the deleted range. It must not be null.

      • getLineOffset

        public int getLineOffset(int lineNum)
        Returns the character offset of the line at the given number, i.e. the sum of lengths of all previous lines, including newlines.

      • selectRange

        public void selectRange(int anchor,
                        int caretPosition)
        Description copied from interface: TextEditingArea
        Positions the anchor and caretPosition explicitly, effectively creating a selection.
        Specified by:
        selectRange in interface TextEditingArea

      • positionCaretIndependently

        public void positionCaretIndependently(int pos)
        Positions only the caret. Doesn't move the anchor and doesn't change the selection. Can be used to achieve the special case of positioning the caret outside or inside the selection, as opposed to always being at the boundary. Use with care.

      • getClassCssMetaData

        public static java.util.List<javafx.css.CssMetaData<? extends javafx.css.Styleable,?>> getClassCssMetaData()
        Returns:
        The CssMetaData associated with this class, which may include the CssMetaData of its super classes.
        Since:
        JavaFX 8.0
